intro: Psychrogeton adylovii, commonly known as the Adylov's psychrogeton, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it thrives in cold, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a vulnerable species.
